text: how is that an ad?!
I wonder if it's because you're in Italy so they probably have less ads to serve
so it's blank
but why would it repeat the menu
did the desktop homepage change again? i thought it had articles on it Monday, but today I'm just getting a search bar to search cards
Looks like the api is down
The thing that serves the articles
do you think that made ads display wonky?
Nah the thing i showed is from a page that doesnt do anything with the api
Ive never seen it before. Might just be some random weird thing. Ill keep checking
very strange
api back up
apparently recommendations.py takes so long now that scheduling it to run every 4 hours was not generous enough
just caught 2 of them running in parallel
with 100% cpu utilization each
looks like it took between 5-6 hours
some of our cron jobs were failing
apis weren’t being restarted due to permissions error
nginx_cmdr_count wasn’t being updated because logrotate is set up differently on ubuntu
fixed now, but our nginx_cmdr_count is kinda weird now
I copied over the table from <http://old.edhrec.com|old.edhrec.com> to get things to run properly again, but it received little to no traffic the past several days
i hate that counting tbh
yeah I’m not a huge fan
comment out the graph
lets see how many people complain
nobody will complain
k
that fucking ad tho
sortable figure it out yet?
they sent some stuff a few min ago I can try it out now and see if it fixes it
re: fancy failure screen
the live website should be handling all 500s properly
but the problem is when something fucks up and the machine grinds to a halt
not sure how we can handle that without another box
i think we need an external service checking in on the website
yeah
we have another box, the articles box
but then we need something to automatically fall back to the other box
or something

here is my thought, unless you wanted to research how other people do it:

1. articles box pings some magical page we have called /areyoualive
2. cehcks the contents to be real
3. if it fails more than 3 times in a row (let’s check every 30 seconds?), we use the AWS API to change route 53 to point to the articles box for <http://edhrec.com|edhrec.com>
4. we have a down page ALWAYS running on <http://articles.edhrec.com|articles.edhrec.com>, so when it moves, it just points to this new thing
aparently anything you do in the console you can do with an api call
hmm interesting
I like most of that idea, but wouldn’t we be waiting for the DNS change to propagate?
the dns changes fairly quick
like <60 sec it seems like
oh ok
it was weird in safari though, like it chached the dns for some reason
firefox didnt do it
well I will look a little into it before I write any code, but that sounds reasonable
k
I do wonder if it would make more sense to do something like
having a 3rd box (or amazon service?) whose only purpose is a router
like I imagine that’s what most websites with larger internal networks do
which isn’t really us
yeah
but might be nice in this case if ti’s cheap/easy
i mean really it would probably be better to do the static hosting in amazon
what exactly do you mean?
all the static pages that nightly generates
we put that in s3 and host the page serverless
something like that. like how you hosted that one react app for ddl
i duno its not worth it tbh
hmmmm
honestly im not even sure if a nice downtime page is worth the effort either
its probably better worth the time to have the watcher script just reboot the box
how could that go wrong? lol
when I rebooted it took like 10 minutes :confused:
yeah
other option is to make it so the server doesn’t go down
:smile:
I like that one
I do want to use AWS as much as possible in the future, since even though it takes more time to learn how to use their stuff, I spend less time fixing random shit that breaks
but obviously switching everything we have right now over would be a huge time sink
yeah
for super secret project #2
we will
I think their suggestion fixed the ad thing
